intro: Boehmeria oblongata, commonly known as Chinese nettle or broadleaf nettle, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes many species of stinging plants. The plant features heart-shaped leaves with a rough, hairy texture and produces small, greenish flowers in clusters. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Boehmeria oblongata is valued for its fibrous stems, which have been used in traditional crafts and papermaking.
